thread.title: Harrison Ford buzzes Dallas-bound American Airlines jet with mistaken taxiway landing
thread.title_full: Harrison Ford buzzes Dallas-bound American Airlines jet with mistaken taxiway landing

author: Tom Steele
title: Harrison Ford buzzes Dallas-bound American Airlines jet with mistaken taxiway landing
text:
Actor Harrison Ford buzzed a Dallas-bound American Airlines plane at a California airport Monday when he landed on a taxiway instead of a runway. Harrison Ford (2016 File Photo/Invision) 
Ford, 74, was told to land on runway 20-L at John Wayne Airport near Los Angeles, NBC News reports , but inadvertently headed toward a runway around noon. 
His single-engine Husky flew just over an American Airlines 737 with 110 passengers and six crew members aboard. 
"Was that airliner meant to be underneath me?" Harrison asked air-traffic controllers, who told the star of Indiana Jones and Star Wars films that he had landed on a taxiway, a recording shows. 
No one was injured. The airliner, American Airlines Flight 1456, took off about 10 minutes behind schedule and landed at DFW International Airport just after 5 p.m., according to FlightAware . 
Ford was given correct landing instructions, the FAA said. 'Star Wars,' 'Indiana Jones' actor Harrison Ford injured in crash landing of small plane 
Ford, who collects vintage planes and is an experience pilot, made headlines when he crash-landed a World War II-era plane in Santa Monica, Calif., two years ago. 
The plane's engine failed and the plane hit a tree; the actor suffered a broken arm and cuts to his head after crashing onto a golf course. View Comments
